Let (S \triangleleft P, \iota ^S, \sigma ^S, \text {pr}^S) and (T \triangleleft Q, \iota ^T, \sigma ^T, \text {pr}^T) be monad containers. A monad container morphism is a container morphism u \triangleleft v : S \triangleleft P \to T \triangleleft Q such that:
\begin {align*} u\ \iota ^S &= \iota ^T\\ u\ (\sigma ^S\ s\ f) &= \sigma ^T\ (u\ s)\ (u \circ f \circ v)\\ \text {pr}^S_1\ (v\ q) &= v\ (\text {pr}^T_1\ q)\\ \text {pr}^S_2\ (v\ q) &= v\ (\text {pr}^T_2\ q) \end {align*}
These are in bijection with monad maps between the monad container extensions of the relevant monad containers.

If (S \triangleleft P, \iota ^S, \sigma ^S, \text {pr}^S) and (T \triangleleft Q, \iota ^T, \sigma ^T, \text {pr}^T) are cartesian, we also get that:
\begin {align*} \text {pr}^{-1^{S}}\ (v\ q , v\ q^\prime ) = v\ (\text {pr}^{-1^{T}}\ (q , q^\prime )) \end {align*}
